medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe early-onset obesity and hyperphagia in siblings.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The 9-year-old girl exhibited an insatiable appetite and rapid weight gain starting at 5 weeks of age with the introduction of bottle-feeding. The 6-year-old boy displayed similar symptoms, rapidly gaining weight after birth. Both children were born with normal weight.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Both siblings were found to be homozygous for a mutation in the leptin gene (p.N103K), leading to detectable but biologically inactive leptin levels.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents are healthy, non-obese Caucasians without known consanguinity. One sibling showed normal weight development.
